definition: educated youth (sent to work in farms during the Cultural Revolution)
to know/to be aware
abbr. for 青海[Qing1 hai3], Qinghai Province
green/blue/black/youth/young (of people)

sentences.english: It is one of complete commune educated youth .
sentences.chinese: 是全公社知青中的第一对。

sentences.english: My dear friends of the educated youth! Have you found your destination yet?
sentences.chinese: 知青朋友啊，你可曾找到你的目的地？

sentences.english: Educated Korea nationality youth W told us a story.
sentences.chinese: 朝鲜族知青W来我们户玩的时候讲了一个故事。

sentences.english: An Kun teacher I know, that time in my educated youth.
sentences.chinese: 我认识安坤老师，那是在我的知青时代。

sentences.english: It is the play of the educated youth that deserves people's concern.
sentences.chinese: 是一部值得关注的知青年代戏。

sentences.english: The appearance of the "Great Leap Forward" broke the Movement that started not so long.
sentences.chinese: “大跃进”的出现中断了起步不久的知青运动。

sentences.english: Hegang "Shenzhou VI" male members of the team posed for pictures in the young Square.
sentences.chinese: 鹤岗“神六”车队男队员在知青广场合影留念。

sentences.english: The confession consciousness of Zhang Kangkang is very representative in the writers of Rusticated Youth.
sentences.chinese: 张抗抗在知青作家中是极具忏悔意识的。

sentences.english: Therefore, the culture of educated youth has become a part in that of Heilongjiang.
sentences.chinese: 知青文化已成为龙江文化的重要内容。

sentences.english: Heavy stone house. 40 years ago, Shanghai young students of the wasted time spent here.
sentences.chinese: 沉重的石屋，上海知青40年前的蹉跎岁月。

sentences.english: "Shenzhou VI" the team's young female players in the square.
sentences.chinese: “神六”车队里的女队员在知青广场。

sentences.english: By 1979, most educated youth were heading back to the cities.
sentences.chinese: 到了1979年，大多数知青返回城市。

definition: to work in the fields (esp. young school-leavers)/forced agricultural experience for city intellectuals
production team

(category defined by the Communist Party) poor and lower-middle peasants: farmers who, before land reform, possessed little or no land (poor peasants) and those who were barely able to support themselves with their own land (lower-middle peasants)
to help develop the border areas
Red Guards (Cultural Revolution, 1966-1976)
May 7 Cadre School (forcing educated people into re-education and peasant labor during Cultural Revolution)/abbr. for 五七幹部學校|五七干部学校[wu3 qi1 gan4 bu4 xue2 xiao4]
school for cadres/May 7 Cadre School 五七幹校|五七干校
branch secretary/secretary of a branch of the Communist Party or the Communist Youth League/abbr. for 支部書記|支部书记
commune member (PRC, 1958-1985)/member of a society (or other organization)
land reform/same as 土地改革[tu3 di4 gai3 ge2]
to go to the countryside
workmate
rebel faction
barefoot doctor/farmer with paramedical training (PRC)
village
baby/small child/(arch.) slave among ethnic minorities
